fields.description:
h3. Problem

The label "Who" in the filtering section on the right of the search screen is unclear. Are you searching in this person's personal space? Are you searching for pages they've created? Or pages they've modified? It's ambiguous.

Discovered during user sessions.

h3. Fix

Add help text to remove the ambiguity.

h3. Reason for severity

Minor use case but causes confusion.
fields.summary: On the search screen, add help text to "Who" field
QuickNav improvement: Add support for spacekey
Please officially support the Metadata plugin

fields.description:
By default the new {jiraissues} macro sets "renderMode=dynamic" by default. Which is a good thing because it is much better, looks cleaner, more user friendly, etc... 

Disadvantage, is when it is used inside of a formatting macro (section or column), the macro still wants to be 100% of the screen, regardless if it is in a 70% column. 

By adding the "renderMode=static" param, it will cause it to stay within the confines of the specified column width, but it's not as useful.
fields.summary: {jiraissues} takes up whole screen even with width set on {column}

fields.description:
The search doesn't work if the search term contains a character like "ä", "ö", "ü", ...
You get the attached picture/screen when you search for the word "über" and no results/hits.
fields.summary: No search results when searching for words like "über", "ähnlich" containing german umlaute

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14622].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

For example, "Renin" suggested "resin" instead of the user "Renan". As with any search algorithm, Did-you-mean doesn't always find the right result immediately. In one case, Did-you-mean even redirected the user to a blank results page. In these cases, the functionality was rendered useless.

Encountered during user sessions.

h3. Fix

Increase the number of suggestions to 2 or 3 to increase the probability of Did-you-mean suggesting the right result. 

h3. Reason for severity

Can lead to dead ends for users.
fields.summary: Did-you-mean doesn't always suggest the right thing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14621].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

Users expect more powerful text entry as filtering seems like "too much work". They expect search to register page content and meta-data in the text they have entered, particularly in regards to the space that the page is a part of. Some even expect the order of their text to make a difference to the results. It doesn't currently register either of these points.

Discovered during user sessions.

h3. Fix

Recognise space names in full text searches and prioritise results that match up to these space names.

h3. Reason for severity

This was encountered in virtually every user session I conducted around searching.
fields.summary: Searching should recognise space names and prioritise results that are contained in this space.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Sam has an internal post about this: http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/~sleberrigaud/2008/12/20/Using+the+keyboard+in+Confluence

Hotkeys allow power users to use Confluence at a speed they are more comfortable with. Confluence currently doesn't have many of these.

h3. Fix

Implement them!

h3. Reason for severity

Atlassian's, and therefore Confluence's, target audience is technical teams. Technical people are more likely to want and use this feature.
fields.summary: Gmail-like hotkeys for Confluence
Put a slight gradient into the Confluence header bar

Change Browse Macros button to Back

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14598].
  {panel}

Viewing the Dashboard with 'My' or 'Team' spaces selected will show recently updated items for those spaces only.

Viewing the Dashboard with 'All' spaces selected will show recently updated items in all spaces, and will also show every users Status Updates.

This is potentially annoying for users, and is unintuitive:

* It is unintuitive as the status updates are unrelated to the space structure, so why would selecting different space views toggle them on and off?
* It is annoying as many users would have valid reasons for wanting to view all recently updated content in all spaces, and currently this can not be done when there are lots of Status Updates showing.

This will especially affect anonymous users, who will see all Status Updates but do not have the option of switching to 'My' or 'Team' views.

The ability to toggle Status Updates should be provided, and be separate from the existing 'All' spaces option.
fields.summary: Status updates are only shown on the Dashboard when all spaces are selected

fields.description:
The Column Macro can only be used within the Section Macro.

Currently the Macro Browser gives no indication of this, which could be confusing for users who haven't read the documentation.

Ideally, the column and section macros would be combined in the MB, so that a user can use it to design and preview their page layouts.

At the very least, the MB should give some warning to a user that entering columns macros on their own will not work.
fields.summary: Using theMacro Browser for Column and Section macros is confusing

fields.description:
Add a page, enter some text, and preview.

In a different browser tab, log out of Confluence.

In the first browser tab, preview again. The login screen is shown.

After entering valid credentials, a system error is given:
{quote}java.lang.NumberFormatException: null
    at java.lang.Long.parseLong(Long.java:372) {quote}


Either logging back into Confluence should work correctly, or the Preview screen should show a user-friendly error message instead of the login screen.
fields.summary: Preview gives an exception when a user is logged out and logs back in again

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14588].
  {panel}

Currently the textarea when editing user macros (Confluence Administration > User macros) is tiny (15 rows, 50 columns). It would be much better and still fit on a typical screen if it was 30 rows by 80 columns). To change the size I edited the following files and changed the rows= and cols= parameters:-

/admin/macros/addusermacro.vm
/admin/macros/updatemacro.vm

I can now use confluence to write complex user macros without having to resort to cutting and pasting from notepad to see what the script looks like with proper indentation etc
fields.summary: User macro edit area is just to small to be usable with complex macros
Color macro should accept both US and International variants of 'colour'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14585].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

The "Browse Space" link is under "Add Content" in the Clickr theme. This makes no logical sense. Those looking for the link under the Browse Space section will not find it there and be temporarily deterred.

h3. Fix

Put it underneath the "Browse Space" section.
fields.summary: "Browse Space" link under "Add Content" in the Clickr theme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14582].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

The padlock that signifies page restrictions is too ambiguous. I don't know what it's telling me. Is it saying (a) that I can't edit the page?, (b) that other people can't edit the page?, or (c) that other people can't view the page? Or is it saying all of the above? I have to go to a separate page to find that out. 

To get more information, the user has to click the page permissions lock. This page very comprehensive and may intimidate those looking for only basic information.

h3. Fix

Here's a list of situations and how I'd expect this functionality to work:

- I can't view the page, I can't edit the page: I don't see the page.
- Everyone can view the page, only I can't edit the page: Remove the edit button, don't use the lock.
- Others can't view the page, I can't edit the page: Remove the edit button, add the lock with a tooltip saying "Some other users can't view this page".
- Everyone can view the page, others can't edit the page: Add the lock with a toolstip saying "Some other users can't edit this page".
- Everyone can view the page, no-one can edit the page: Remove the edit button, add the lock with a tooltip saying "Some other users can't edit this page".
- Others can't view the page, others can't edit the page: Add the lock with a tooltip saying "Some other users can't view or edit this page".

h3. Reason for severity

I gave this a major severity because...
- It's pervasive (i.e. on all pages with restrictions).
- There is no middle ground that solves the problem - users are either left with not enough or too much.
fields.summary: Improve padlock (page restrictions) tooltips

fields.description:
There is no guide on how to determine the values available for the "columns" parameter of the [jiraissues|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/JIRA+Issues+Macro] macro (both system fields and custom fields). This can make the macro difficult to configure.

Reference ticket: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-28967
fields.summary: Document down how to determine values for jiraissues column parameter
PDF Space export with attachments macro does not render the "Edit/Remove" link with comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14572].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

Some users get frustrated by the fact that they have to click "View" and then click "Edit" before they can edit the page. This was discovered during user sessions.

h3. Fix

Add an "Edit" button in to the right of the "View" link.

h3. Reason for priority

This is a minor use case that is easily overcome. It's slightly annoying.
fields.summary: Include "Edit" button in Page Info view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14571].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

Some users rely on labels to sort through blog posts on the Browse News page. At the moment, labels aren't displayed. This was discovered during user sessions.

h3. Fix

Include labels in this page.

h3. Reason for severity

I gave this a minor severity because...
- To my knowledge, this seems like a minor use case. Although in this case, the user is greatly inhibited.
fields.summary: Include labels on Browse News page

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Some users expect News Items to act in the same way as Pages - to be able to restrict permission when it is a "work-in-progress", and then take off the permissions when they want to publish it. This was found during user sessions.

h3. Fix

Give news items permissioning capabilities.

h3. Reason for severity

Users that have encountered this problem have worked around it in fairly complex ways. We would reduce these user's workload significantly by adding these permissioning capabilities.
fields.summary: Give permissioning capabilities to news items

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When browsing a space or viewing/editing your preferences, as you change to a separate tab the title of the page and the contents of the breadcrumbs change. This is an unconventional use of tabs - usually they only change what is underneath them. It follows that changing anything above them is not useful and therefore creates unnecessary visual noise.

h3. Fix

Leave the page title and breadcrumbs constant. When browsing a space, they should remain as "Browse Space" (or "Browse [Space Name] Space"). When editing your profile or looking at your drafts, the title should remain as "Stephen Russell" (can't think of a more meaningful title at the moment).
fields.summary: When switching tabs in browse mode, for example, the page title is unconventionally altered on the page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14566].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

"View" sub-navigation when browsing a space is inconsistent with other sub-navigations and risks being missed due to its lightweight styling.

h3. Fix

Align it with the sub-navigation used in the Profile screen, currently being [redesigned|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-14538].
fields.summary: "View" sub-navigation when browsing a space is inconsistent with other sub-navigations

fields.description:
h3. Problem

The old styling for boxes in this style has unnecessary visual elements.

h3. Fix

Align it with the current fixed-width styling, currently seen in the help tips panel in WikiMarkup page editing mode and on the right in user's personal spaces.

h3. Reason for priority

I gave this a minor priority because...
- I'm unsure as to the popularity of this part of the product. If it was unpopular, I'd mark it as trivial. If it was popular, I'd mark it as major.
fields.summary: In Browse Labels screen, Recent Labels and Popular Labels boxes on the right should be aligned with the current (future) styling.
Anonymous users can use plugins to bypass restrictions to access User Profile information

fields.description:
CONF-13276 introduces a new permissions setting for anonymous users.

This is appearing on the Administrator Console as 'permissions.VIEWUSERPROFILES'

According to CONF-14361 it should be called 'View User Profiles'
fields.summary: Anonymous User permissions name is not showing correctly in the Administrator Console

fields.description:
The following in the RTE will cause an unknown macro error:


<history.dir>${history.dir}-foo</history.dir>

So I wrapped it in a  code macro and it displayed fine, however, if I edit the text again, the <history.dir> and </history.dir> goes missing and I get back the following in the editor.

${history.dir}-foo
fields.summary: RTE does not deal with <foo> correctly.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

The term "Children" is not immediately understood.

h3. Fix

Call it "Child Pages".
fields.summary: Change "Children" to "Child Pages"

fields.description:
The first time I try to change a password it gives me the errors:

You must enter a value as your current password. (for Current Password)
You must enter a value as your new password. (for New Password)
 You must enter a value for your new password confirmation. (New Password Confirmation)

The second time I enter in the exact information it works perfectly.

Yes, I know my password.  As I change my password back and forth I can repeat this behavior (all-out errors on first post followed by working on the second one) each time.
======
FYI, it was my *BOSS* (who will be writing the check) who found this error, which is why I listed it as major, as he was very happy with the confluence up until this point.  At this point it will be a hard sell unless I can convince him that these types of bugs get fixed very quickly.
fields.summary: change password error on eval site

fields.description:
We have a number of Confluence pages which include data table names whose component words are separated by underscores, e.g., cat_dog.  However, we cannot search for pages that contain cat_dog without getting all pages that contain cat &/or dog.
In an e-mail response to my http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Search+Syntax?&#comments question, Komathi Krishnan [Atlassian] indicated this is related to the Lucene indexing service (and consequently is likely present in all versions of Confluence using it).  If a change could be made to allow searching for only pages containing underscore_separated strings, that would be appreciated.
fields.summary: Change search so that searching for cat_dog returns only pages w/cat_dog, instead of pages with cat &/or dog

fields.description: These terms are pervasive on the Internet. They are much more meaningful and understandable to the general public. We should embrace this.
fields.summary: Change the words "News Item" to "Blog Post" and "News" to "Blog"
Recognise the PNG file format as an image.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Some users expect to be able to add a label from the "Add" menu. They don't see it as being different from a comment or attachment.

h3. Fix

Include "Label" in the "Add" menu above "Comment".

h3. Severity

Gave this a major priority because...
- Labels is a function that seems important to Confluence's future. It's highly prioritised in the search and should thus be prioritised more in the interface.
- When there are no existing labels, the "Add Labels" link at the bottom of the page [can be missed|https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/browse/UI-809]. In other words, a workaround for this problem can be difficult.
fields.summary: Include "Label" option into the "Add" menu.

fields.description: The output from the JIRA Issues Macro displays the word "JIRA" in lowercase (please see the docs for an example: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/JIRA+Issues+Macro)
fields.summary: "Jira" should be in capitals

fields.description:
Right now the XStream serializer used in Confluence is configured to use a delegating classloader that only delegates to the PluginsClassLoader. This causes ClassNotFoundExceptions when trying to deserialize an instance of a class which is not part of a plugin. It starts working though as soon as a StaticPlugin is loaded, because StaticPlugins use the application class loader (which is a really bad side effect).
We should use a class loader that tries the application class loader first and then the plugins class loader.
fields.summary: The XStream serializer only uses the plugins class loader

fields.description:
The current left-hand navigation style contains many visual elements that are unnecessary and it doesn't match the visual direction for Confluence. It is contained on multiple screens in the product, including the Administration section and the Profile screen.

Here is the redesign: https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/secure/attachment/17488/0.01.3.png

Part of: https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/browse/UI-757

Use the same margins and padding that we use in the Dialog. Use the same type of rounded corner that is everywhere else in Confluence.

I gave this major priority because the Profile screen will be one of the main features of 3.0 so it is important to get it looking and feeling progressive.
fields.summary: Change left-hand navigation style and add collapse/expand.

fields.description:
Add a page such as "Chad's Test Page" to a space. Alter it so that only you can view/edit this page.
Add a child page to this, called.. say.. "Testing Page".   Try to alter the permissions on this page, and you get

"permissionsTable is not defined" in a javascript popup.

I've selected 2.9.1 as an affected version, as someone in CONF-10717 said it was. I'm personally testing on 2.10.1.

This is a pretty critical bug for us, but feel free to mark it down. We are doing a thorough evaluation of how far we can lock things down, and this is an area that is impacting us.

Thanks,

Chad
fields.summary: Can not alter the permissons on a page, if the parent page has permissions and the parent has an apostrophe in the page name. Similar to CONF-10717

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14534].
  {panel}

when i type the chinese word in dashboard search field, the search list tip does't show, but type english word, it's show.

I try to debug this problem, i find this file "confluence\includes\js\contentnamesearch.js", line: 157 
"url: contextPath + "/json/contentnamesearch.action?query=" + AJS.escape(val),"
I modify this line like this
"url: contextPath + "/json/contentnamesearch.action?query=" + encodeURI(AJS.escape(val)),"

and the problem is resolved.
fields.summary: when i type the chinese word in dashboard search field, the search list tip does't show

fields.description: To do something useful with the content name search results apart from linking to their view you need the id.
fields.summary: Expose the id in content name search results
Allow the request path for the content name search to be a function

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When commenting on a page in WikiMarkup mode, the usual help included when editing a page is nowhere to be seen. It can only be accessed by finding the link through the edit page mode. The majority of users who don't have an expert command of WikiMarkup would find more immediately available help useful.

h3. Fix

!Solution.png|thumbnail!

h3. Reason for critical severity

Commenting is pervasive throughout Confluence and many users use only WikiMarkup. The workaround requires substantial effort.
fields.summary: When commenting on a page in WikiMarkup mode, there is no way for me to access the notation guide.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14526].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

On the attachments view for each page, the comment text field moves location depending on the size of the browser window. It can sometimes sit unnecessarily far from the attachments box.

h3. Fix

Fix the location of the comment text field to sit 10px to the right of the attachment field.
fields.summary: On the attachments view for each page, fix the comment text field 10px to the right of the attachment field.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14525].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

When removing a comment on a page, Confluence takes the user back to the top of the page. While this isn't a huge problem in one-off cases, when deleting an entire conversation (with multiple nested comments), repeatedly scrolling back down and finding the same conversation will cause user frustration.

h3. Fix

*Option 1*

When someone removes a comment, go to the permalink of a comment closest to the deleted comment. I imagined it working something like this:
- If you delete a child of a comment, go to the parent comment. 
- If you delete a parent comment, go to the permalink of the child comment. 
- If you delete a singular comment, go to the permalink of the comment underneath.

*Option 2*

When the user clicks "Remove", after confirmation, the comment automatically disappears. The loading and processing of this operation is done in the background.

h3. Reason for priority

While this will cause user frustration it's a limited use case.
fields.summary: Page should stay in the same location after a comment has been deleted.

fields.description:
The "My" tab on the dashboard is ambiguous - My what? My spaces? My favourite spaces? My most edited spaces? We should change it to say "Favourite" as this is what it contains - favourite spaces.

The "All" tab is incorrect. It's not all spaces as it doesn't list personal spaces. It should say "Global".

Rated with Major priority because...
- It's seen by and accessible to pretty much all users.
- It's requires investigation on behalf of the user to find out exactly what it means. It shouldn't need this.
- It doesn't completely stop someone from achieving a goal (they can always go to "All" spaces as a workaround).

It should also be noted that this problem will be getting fixed by the new Space Picker. If this is a hard fix then perhaps it will be best to wait until this feature has been implemented.
fields.summary: Change the "My" Spaces tab on the dashboard to say "Favourite" and "All" to "Global".

  {panel}

We use Confluence on top of JOnAS 4.8.6 that includes Tomcat 5.5.17.

The previous version of Confluence work fine and the 2.9.2 version is in production.

However we can't use Confluence 2.10 and 2.10.1 because those versions prevent our application server to call external EJB. In fact, this is a critical issue for us because all of our security model relies on EJB and RemoteLoginModule.
For instance when I try to login on Confluence I get the following exception :

The issue seems to come from Felix.
After few researches, I've found that Confluence use twice almost the same library of Felix :
org.apache.felix.framework-1.2.1-atlassian-3.jar
org.apache.felix.main-1.2.1-atlassian-3.jar

For me, the 1st one is useless.

The JOnAS experts told me that upgrading to the latest version of Felix (1.4.0) could solve the problem.

So after upgrading to Felix 1.4.0 I can login. However several plugins doesn't deploy any more :

Finally, my request is that I'd like Confluence to be upgraded with Felix >=1.4.0 for the next releases.

fields.description:
As documented, the stylesheets are available for Space Administrators:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Basic+Styling+Tutorial

{quote}
   1.  Log in as the Space Administrator.
   2. Open the Space Admin page.
   3. Click 'Stylesheet'.
   4. Click 'Edit' to change the code in the text field.
   5. Paste your custom CSS into the text field. (Once text is saved here, you can make adjustments to it inline.)
   6. Click 'Save'. The new CSS will be visible on all content pages in the space.
{quote}

Only confluence-administrators have access to the layouts. The link does not appear for space admins, and browsing directly to the URL shows a permissions error (like http://localhost:8080/spaces/viewstylesheet.action?key=ds). 

Attached is a screenshot showing the space admin tab without the stylesheet link, which is a state that should not exist (or the documentation needs changing).
fields.summary: Space administrators do not have access to custom css

fields.description:
A customer has recently experienced this bug.  The initial problem was that their space export kept failing and after further testing and troubleshooting, it was found out that the deleted content in the trash was at fault.  Upon trying to purge the trash through the UI, it failed.  The workaround was to create an sql script that cleaned up and deleted everything associated to all of the content that was marked as deleted.

This is apparently a known bug but we were not able to find a bug report for it.  Apparently, the TEST space on confluence.atlassian.com also fails to purge.
fields.summary: Large amounts of deleted content may cause Purge All Trash to fail

fields.description:
The combo of a bulleted list (and numbered list) w/ a heading inside a table creates the error condition whenever you edit, switch between rich text/wiki markup.

Here is an example. 

Copy the code into Wiki Markup editor and then switch it to Rich Text editor and back.

{code}
| h1. test
* item1
* item2
* item3 |
{code}

The problem is whenever switching between Rich Text Editor and Wiki Markup Editor, the Bulleted item is appended to the end of Heading (one at a time).

Result:
{code}
| h1. test* item1
* item2
* item3 |
{code}
fields.summary: The combo of a bulleted list (and numbered list) w/ a heading inside a table creates the error condition whenever you edit, switch between rich text/wiki markup.

fields.description:
By default, Confluence now surrounds search terms in the "Manage Users" search with wildcards.  This causes problems for large LDAP implementations, the full search (on all three fields) will time out.

A configuration option to turn off the wilcards would be useful for these environments.
fields.summary: Wildcards in "manage user" searches cause performance problems with large LDAP repositories

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14503].
  {panel}

A user has added watches to pages in different wiki spaces he has access to. These watches were immediately sending email whenever someone modified a page Our user didn't like that, so instead selected the Email Preferences option to "Subscribe to daily updates". 

The user expected the "Subscribe to Daily Updates" to send him a daily email showing ONLY updates to the pages he was watching.

What the user actually got was a daily email showing changes to any pages that the user was able to view throughout the entire system. It was not limited to just pages he was watching.

The new feature request is for the ability to enable daily email notifications, but ONLY for watched pages. NOT for all pages the user can view.
fields.summary: Ability to have daily summary of ONLY watches, not all pages.

fields.description:
Here's one example:

  http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/UWC+SSL+Support

These image thumbnails should have a 1px black border, but they do not. Oddly enough, they _do_ have a border if you view them in the RTE.

The border=1 attribute is applied. It's visible in the HTML. However, it's being overridden by the {{a img \{ border:none; \} }} declaration in the master.css.

The right way to fix this is make the border applied via CSS instead of the old HTML attribute border=1.
fields.summary: Borders are not applied to image thumbnails

The following Jira solved the problem for the information displayed in the user Browser:
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-12360

fields.description:
The jiraissues macro has a refresh icon to the left of the "Displaying 1 to x of x items" text. This works in Firefox, but often doesn't refresh anything on IE IE 7.0.5730.13.

For instance:
 - I load the page
 - middle-click an issue to edit it in another tab
 - change the status, eg. click "Start progress"
 - Return to the confluence page, and click the refresh icon

The issue with the changed status does not update.  Watching the access logs, no HTTP queries are being made.  Even hitting f5 to refresh the page doesn't cause HTTP queries or refresh the page.
fields.summary: jiraissues macro refresh does not work in IE 7 (version 7.0.5730.13)

fields.description: Please add logging to Confluence to log when a macro is run.  This should be controllable by a system property as this is easiest for my perf tests to control.
fields.summary: Add a system property to enable logging of Macros used.
Add the ability to Hibernate to have more than one index per column

fields.description:
Most of the commonly used queries on the SpacePermissions table are queries on the permtype, user and group columns together, but we have no composite index on these columns.

Adding one should greatly improve performance to these queries.

This change creates very little risk, since the Space Permissions table is very rarely updated.

One large system experienced improved performance when such an index was added to its oracle database.

Note that this index might be ineffective in some systems because the column values and the query values involve NULLs, which can sometimes limit the effectiveness of an index.
fields.summary: There should be a composite index on some of the columns in SpacePermissions table

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/View+File+Macro#ViewFileMacro-EditingtheExcelSpreadsheet

While this is quite easy to do, it is not that intuitive.  Is it possible to create an edit button for the document.

fields.description:
Purging Trash across a large number of spaces can be an administrative pain. It would be useful if items in Trash could be manipulated via the Remote API. Useful methods would include:

* List all Trash items for a given space
* Purge a given page from a given space's Trash
* Purge all pages form a given space's Trash

fields.description:
Filing this on behalf of a customer.

Christina asked that I describe the "quirky behavior" I'm seeing in the Confluence editor. 

The main problem is that I am having trouble getting outline formatting to work the way I want it to. If I have the following code:

{noformat}
# The graduating student makes decisions affecting the practice of dentistry based on ethical principles and as prescribed by law. The graduating student...

## Practices as obliged by principles of ethics and the ADA Code of Ethics

## Practices within the context of the appropriate state Dental Practice Act.

# The graduating student participates in professional self-regulation. The graduating student...

## Practices within the context of the appropriate state Dental Practice Act.

## Understands the need for and establishes a plan for personal/professional growth and development.
{noformat}

It does not seem to be possible to insert a space between the numbered items, so everything is run together without line breaks.  If you insert a space, it restarts the numbering.  This isn't a deal-breaking issue, but it affects the readability of the page.

As I think through this, most of the complaints I have are with TinyMCE, or maybe specifically the TinyMCE implementation in Confluence.  I don't expect it to have all of the functionality of Word, but it seems impractical to try to expose functionality like outline formatting if usability is limited in this way.

It's also possible that I am approaching this from the wrong direction or don't understand completely how to use the editor!  If you can help me get these pages looking nice, or if I should take this over to the user forum, please let me know.

Thanks for your help.

Doug
fields.summary: Cannot put extra space in numbered list without resetting numbers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14476].
  {panel}

Guest accounts have too much access to features and content. We would like to be able to apply some (or preferably all) of the following restrictions:
* No access to Feed Builder (guests don't need to be able to build an RSS feed)
* No access to People Directory (unless we choose to expose it)
* No links or menu to go to Browse Space (only view by pages, links in pages, and attachments) - especially no Advanced options
* No link to the Notation Guide
* No "info" view of pages.
fields.summary: Allow more restricted access for guests
speed improvement in page tree view - don't force resort after each page move

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14474].
  {panel}

Having the page name as the default page title on each page is poor design, since the formatting of titles and page names have two different (and sometimes opposing) goals. I would like either of the following:
1) a macro to specify the page title to be used in place of the page name, or
2) a separate field to specify the page name when creating/editing a page.

With thousands of pages, we need names to reflect the hierarchy somewhat or they easily get lost or run into naming duplications. That doesn't make them good page titles, though.
fields.summary: Page Title separate from page name
Improve display of labels, children, and comments at bottom of page
Improve History to show all pages visited recently (except searches) OR offer breadcrumb option to track recent instead of hierarchy
Add Contacts as space object, much like Bookmarks are. Include import and export.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14470].
  {panel}

Display a calendar on a page based on a .ics file attached to the page or space. Macro should include some settings for things like:
type=mini | cal | list   - where "mini" is a small month view with asterisk by dates with events, "cal" is a typical calendar display with events showing, "list" is a text listing.
display=day | work | week | month   - identifying whether to display a single day, work week, full week, or month of events (only work with "cal" and "list" types)
date = <date> - identifying the date to display. For month view it displays the full month containing that date, week view displays the week containing that date.

With the WebDAV plugin, updating of the .ics file could be done via any calendar client, so there is no need for event editing, just display.
fields.summary: Display calendar in page from .ics file attached to page or space. Edit via WebDAV.
